result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica N. Cortes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to 15-CF-344.   263 days credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay fine of $200.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided)
** Pay DNA surcharge
** Pay restitution plus surcharges - Joint and severally with 14-CF-1453  May Not have contact with TCF Bank, State Bank of the Lakes or BMO Harris Bank and NO Contact with Timothy LeBoeuf without permission of the agent.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:29pm-  Matter heard with 15CF344.  Victim rights compliance.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 10 years w/conditions - consecutive to 15CF344.  Court orders $200.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge.  DE stipulates to restitution.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $4,393.00 - joint & several w/ co-defendant.  DE to submit DNA surcharge (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.
Due to ongoing jury trial (State v. Meyer),  8/4/2015 Sentencing hearing is rescheduled to 8/27/2015 at 3pm.  Parties notified via email.
7/16/2015 Sentencing hearing is rescheduled to 8/4/2015 at 3pm by the Court due to time constraints.  Parties notified in court.
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  4:02pm-  Matter heard with 15CF344.  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty; found guilty by the court.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Jerold Breitenbach.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  NO RECORD -  DE was not brought over for today's hearing as Attorney Breitenbach was occupied in another court.  Pre-trial conference adjourned to May 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm - to be heard w/ co-defendant's case.  Bond continued.

Defendant, Jessica N. Cortes, appeared with Attorney Jerold William Breitenbach.  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. New charges will likely be filed. Parties stipulate to an adjournment so that the new cases may be heard with the existing files.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.
12-16-14 Preliminary Hearing/Arraignment
Today's FPT rescheduled to 03-05-15 at 10:30 as agreed upon by the parties to allow more time for discovery.

1:56pm  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jerold Breitenbach. Clerk:LErvin.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Referred to Br7. for further disposition on 02-05-2015 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Diane Caspari. Clerk LE. KSD Deputy John Hasselbrink sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Caspari. PPPD Det. Heather Mogensen sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Caspari. Probable cause found. Caspari discovers conflict of interest in discovery and requests to withdraw. Court grants request. SPD's office to appoint new counsel. Plea not entered. Arraignment on 12-30-14 @ 1:00pm. Bond continued.
